intro: Skolemora pernambucensis, commonly known as the Pernambuco skolemora, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Skolemora pernambucensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
